definition: to fasten with rivets/(coll.) to exert one's strength

mortise (slot cut into wood to receive a tenon)/4th earthly branch: 5-7 a.m., 2nd solar month (6th March-4th April), year of the Rabbit/ancient Chinese compass point: 90° (east)/variant of 鉚|铆[mao3]/to exert one's strength
see 鉚釘槍|铆钉枪[mao3 ding1 qiang1]
lit. a nail is a nail and a rivet is a rivet (idiom)/fig. meticulous/conscientious/unambiguous
pinyin: ding1 shi4 ding1 , mao3 shi4 mao3

definition: to go all out/to rise to
to apply all one's strength in a burst of effort
to get enthusiastic/to put in all one's energy

sentences.english: For many years the standard method was riveting .
Precision non-standard fasteners and some standard fasteners.
